speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Daphne. [_He enters._] Is Dad around?  I have that videotape he wanted to see.

speaker: Daphne
text: Actually, he's gone off with Donny.  They went to a tractor pull.

speaker: Niles
text: Ohhh... [_He looks questioningly at her._]

speaker: Daphne
text: As I understand it, they attach a large weight to a tractor and see how far they can pull it through the mud.

speaker: Niles
text: Ohhh... [_His brow furrows._]

speaker: Daphne
text: The answer to your next question is "Beats the hell out of me."

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello, Daphne, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Frasier.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane.  I see you've grown yourself a crumb-catcher.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please.  Spare me your jocular euphemisms.  I've heard them all from Freddie: my chin-sweater,  my face-fuzz, my hickey-hider.

speaker: Niles
text: [_laughing_] Well, I think it suits you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, thank you, Niles.  I just wanted to shake things up a bit, you know.

speaker: Niles
text: How was Boston?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it was fine.  It was great seeing Freddie again.  Of course, Lilith was insufferable.  She's got a new boyfriend, some twenty-eight year old named Marcel, he's a contortionist with the Cirque de Soleil.

speaker: Niles
text: She's dating French circus folk?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Well, he's actually perfect for Lilith: he has no apparent spine and she can wrap him around her finger. Of course, Lilith's smug satisfaction was a little hard to bear, though.  Especially considering how long it's been since the circus came to my town.

speaker: Donny
text: I know!  I couldn't believe the weight of that thing! [_spotting Frasier_] Well, it's Grizzly Crane!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, nice soup-strainer there, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, we just saw a hell of a tractor pull.  Even you would have liked it.

speaker: Martin
text: So, how's my grandson?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, he's great, Dad.  Actually, he loved the baseball mitt you sent him.

speaker: Donny
text: [_taking off the ball cap he's wearing_] Where's Daphne? I got this little gift for her.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, a John Deere cap.  How... could you?

speaker: Donny
text: Oh no, I'm just giving it to her to see her pretend to like it.  Then I'm gonna give her a bracelet.  _He goes off to Daphne's room.  Frasier answers the door to reveal Roz._

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hi Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hmmm, cool beard!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, thanks!

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: [_handing Frasier an envelope_] OK, here's the directions, hotel confirmation and schedule.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Roz
text: Broadcast conference.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good lord!  I thought that was next week.

speaker: Roz
text: No, it's tonight!  I'm going up there right now.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh no, Roz.  I just got back from Boston, for God's sake. You know, maybe I could just drive up tomorrow and attend the panels.

speaker: Roz
text: No Frasier, tonight's reception's the most important part! It sets the tone for the whole weekend.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on!  Last year everybody just got drunk and acted like a bunch of horny teenagers.

speaker: Roz
text: Exactly!  So stop yakkin' and start packin'!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you know, it could be just the relief you need after a long week with Lilith and Le Pretzel Boy.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, come to think of it, there was one really gorgeous blonde up there: Rush Hour Rita, Larame's Eye in the Sky.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, I remember her.  The traffic was bumper to bumper outside her ROOM.

speaker: Frasier
text: Meow, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, it's just that I am so sick of men becoming panting idiots just at the sight of blonde hair.

speaker: Niles
text: That is a bit of an oversimplification, Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_At the same time as Niles, then continuing alone_] Don't be ridiculous.  It's insulting, Roz!  For God's sake, I mean, every man's taste is different.

speaker: Roz
text: Sorry, it's just that I met this guy at Nervosa today for coffee and it was very annoying.  Every time I tried to say anything, this blonde waitress would walk by...

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Mimi's back?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's good news.

speaker: Niles
text: Gotta stop in and see Mimi.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I guess I better get packing!

speaker: Martin
text: What're you talking about?  You got your bags right there.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Dad, these are my "Daddy" clothes.  I have to go and pack my "Come to Daddy" clothes. _Donny and Daphne come from her room.  Daphne is wearing the cap, Donny is on the phone._

speaker: Donny
text: Oh, will you give me a break?  All right, all right! [_Disconnects._]  My surveillance guy just cancelled for tonight, just when I need him for this big money divorce case.

speaker: Daphne
text: Is this the Stanley Redmond thing?

speaker: Donny
text: Yeah, the dumpster rental king.  This guy controls half the dumpsters in the Northwest, his wife thinks he's been taking out the wrong kind of trash.  You know, if I can prove it, this case is mine.

speaker: Niles
text: That is so depressing.  You expect this sort of behavior from a mattress king, but we ask more of our dumpster royalty.

speaker: Donny
text: Yeah, but you should see this girlfriend: leggy, blonde...

speaker: Niles
text: [_to Roz_] Oh, well, blonde!  That explains it!

speaker: Roz
text: [_getting up in a huff_] Goodbye.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm sorry. [_She leaves._]

speaker: Donny
text: Hey, wait a minute.  Marty?  You were a cop, right?  You must've done surveillance.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh sure, all the time.

speaker: Donny
text: Well, why don't you work for me tonight?  It's forty-five bucks an hour.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I don't think Dad would want to do that.

speaker: Martin
text: Forty-five bucks?

speaker: Donny
text: All right, fifty.  But if you get a picture of Redmond and the girl, then it's a five hundred dollar bonus.

speaker: Martin
text: Five hundred dollars?

speaker: Donny
text: All right, seven hundred, you're killing me.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, I don't think this is a good idea.  Where exactly is this stakeout?

speaker: Donny
text: It's at the Alcazar apartments.  You know, in Belltown.

speaker: Niles
text: Belltown is sort of a sketchy neighborhood, wouldn't you say?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh Niles, to you a sketchy neighborhood is when the cheese shop doesn't have valet parking.  I'm an ex-cop, remember?

speaker: Niles
text: Yeah, yeah, I know you're an ex-cop.  Let's just examine this, Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: No, no, no.  Let's just forget about it.  I'm not gonna listen to this all night.  I just won't do it, are you satisfied?

speaker: Niles
text: [_getting up to leave_] Yes.  Thank you.  Donny, I'm sorry to put a crimp in your plans.

speaker: Donny
text: No, that's all right.  I'm sure I'll find somebody else. [_as the door closes on Niles, he turns to Martin_] You're still doing it, right?

speaker: Martin
text: Hell, yes! _FADE OUT  Scene 2 - Roz's Hotel Room._

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks for watching Alice, Laurie.  I really owe you one... Well, I just want to get down to this cocktail party before all the good men are taken... What?  I just want to have a little fun tonight... No!  I do not mean that... All right, I do mean that. [_There is a knock at the door._] Uh, Laurie, I'll talk to you later.  Thank you again, bye-bye.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, hey Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi Roz.  My room isn't ready yet, can I put my stuff here until I can check in?

speaker: Roz
text: Come on in.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thanks.  I tell you, the storm hasn't dampened the festivities downstairs.  It's only seven o'clock and Marge Whitmeyer is already in the bar arm-wrestling people for drinks.

speaker: Roz
text: How many did you buy her?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, three, but my elbow was in a wet spot.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, did you happen to notice if that weather guy from KSGY was down there?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I noticed that he was there.  Something tells me the forecast calls for a collision between two warm fronts. _Roz grins at him and arches her eyebrows.  The phone rings and Roz gets it._

speaker: Roz
text: Hello?  Oh, yeah, he's here. [_hands the phone to Frasier_] It's the front desk.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Yes?  Well then, you'll just have to get me a room elsewhere!  I see.  Thank you very much. [_he hangs up_] They don't have a room for me.

speaker: Roz
text: [_looking nervous_] What're you gonna do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, guess I could stay on the couch.

speaker: Roz
text: What!?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on Roz!  I got no choice!  The whole island is booked.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, this is sure gonna cramp my style.  I mean, it's not like college when everybody just... never mind.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know Roz, we're two attractive people.  We're at a conference that turns into a bacchanal every year, odds are neither of us will need this room tonight.

speaker: Roz
text: You're right.  What's the problem?

speaker: Frasier
text: I believe there's a cocktail party awaiting us?

speaker: Roz
text: Let's go down together.  [_taking his arm_]  We'll be like jackals, they hunt in pairs.

speaker: Frasier
text: I like your self-assurance.  There's no greater aphrodisiac than confidence.

speaker: Roz
text: Shall we?

speaker: Frasier
text: Let the games begin!

speaker: Roz
text: I just need a little more lipstick.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm sweatin' right through this shirt.  _FADE OUT  End of Act 1  Act 2_ **FORGET IT MARTY, IT'S BELLTOWN** _Scene 1 - A Surveillance Van. Marty is sitting in the passenger's seat, watching a building with binoculars.  Niles comes to the driver's side.  Seeing Martin, he glares and bangs on the door._

speaker: Martin
text: [_opening the door_] Niles...

speaker: Niles
text: You specifically promised me...

speaker: Martin
text: Would you shut up and get in here?

speaker: Martin
text: How did you know I was here?

speaker: Niles
text: The doorman!

speaker: Martin
text: Bigmouth.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I guess he didn't realize he was being sworn to secrecy when you said "Hey Sid, I'm goin' on a stakeout."  I can't believe you lied to me.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I'm sorry, but you were makin' such a big fuss about nothing.

speaker: Niles
text: It is not nothing!  Look at this neighborhood. [_looking in the side-view mirror_] I'm not even happy parking my Mercedes here.

speaker: Martin
text: It's not that bad.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, really?  Well then could you explain to me the ominous group of men standing back there in the shadows by my car? [_Martin looks out the back._] They're all wearing the same sort of dark coat, it's some sort of gang.

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, they're Hasidic Jews.

speaker: Niles
text: That's right, keep walking, keep walking...

speaker: Martin
text: So, what, you came down here to bawl me out?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes... partly.  Also to give you this.

speaker: Martin
text: What's this?

speaker: Niles
text: Clam chowder.

speaker: Martin
text: [_happy_] Oh-ho!

speaker: Niles
text: I remember Mom used to make it for you when you went ice fishing, and I hated the thought of you sitting out here cold and hungry.

speaker: Martin
text: Well thank you, I appreciate it.  But, look, why don't you just go back home, now.  I'll be fine.

speaker: Niles
text: No, I'll just stay awhile, you could use the company.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, come on, Niles, why don't you tell me what's really on your mind?

speaker: Niles
text: All right, Dad, I was worried about you.

speaker: Martin
text: I knew it.  Because I'm an old man and I can't take care of myself!

speaker: Niles
text: No.  Age has nothing to do with it.  I've always worried about you, that's what it's like when your father's a cop. I worried about you when I was five years old.  And I didn't stop worrying until the day you retired.  And today just brought it all back again.

speaker: Martin
text: Look, I'm sorry.  For what it's worth, I know what you mean. My dad was a cop, too.

speaker: Niles
text: I know.

speaker: Martin
text: But, you know, Niles, I'm not chasin' after bad guys. I'm just gonna take a picture.

speaker: Niles
text: That's true.  I'm probably overreacting like usual.  Uh, well I guess I'll head home.

speaker: Martin
text: No, no, hey wait a little bit.  Stick around.  How'd you like a little clam chowder?

speaker: Niles
text: I'd love some!

speaker: Martin
text: [_opening thermos_] OK! [_he sniffs_] This is clam chowder!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, what'd you expect?

speaker: Martin
text: Irish whiskey!  Your mother always filled it with coffee and Irish whiskey!  We just called it clam chowder in front of you kids.

speaker: Niles
text: [_with a thoughtful look_] Is that why you got so mad that day I crumbled oyster crackers in your thermos?  _Martin makes a face and closes the thermos.  FADE OUT.  Scene 2 - Roz's Hotel Room Roz is in her nightgown and robe, putting her hair up.  Frasier comes in._

speaker: Roz
text: What happened to you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Same thing that happened to you... I got a hug goodnight.

speaker: Roz
text: Where did we go wrong?  Rush Hour Rita was draping herself all over you, and that news guy actually said to me if I gave him twenty-two minutes he'd give me the world.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I don't know, Roz.  After he gave you the brush-off, he came over and sat down next to me and Rita.  Before I knew it, they had discovered their mutual fondness for tango music.

speaker: Roz
text: I lose out to tango music?  What a night!   A total bust!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on, Roz.  You know, for my money, you were the most attractive woman down there.

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks, Frasier.  And I'm not just saying this to return the favor, but you look really hot in that beard.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, thanks.  You know, maybe we're better off, just a couple of old friends having a cozy evening together.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, right. [_There is a knock at the door._] It's him!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's her!   Both: Come in, hello.  [_They open it to find a waiter._]

speaker: Waiter
text: Sorry to disturb you, but the manager wanted to apologize for the mix-up with the room. [_He puts down a champagne bucket._] This is on us.

speaker: Roz
text: That's nice.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you in the mood for a glass of champers, Roz?

speaker: Roz
text: I don't know, what do you think?

speaker: Waiter
text: It won't fit in the mini-bar.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's settled then.  I can open it myself, thanks. [_Tips him._] Here you are.

speaker: Waiter
text: Thank you.  [_He leaves._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, ah.  Demi-sec, respectable label, not a bad year. We may just be having a better time than anybody else here.  _From the room above comes the sound of tango music and dancing. They both glower at the ceiling.  FADE OUT.  Scene 3 - The Van Martin is watching the apartment house, Niles has a set of headphones on, hooked to a parabolic dish mike._

speaker: Niles
text: [_loudly_] Dad, this thing is amazing!  I can actually hear some guy brushing his teeth!  Swish, swish, spit.  Swish, swish... flossing!

speaker: Martin
text: Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: You have got to try this, it's incredible!  Here, put those on... [_Hands Martin the headphones._]

speaker: Martin
text: [_unenthused_]  All right.

speaker: Niles
text: [_giving him the mike_]  All right, now point that anywhere you want.  _Martin takes the mike, but as he's moving it towards the window it is pointed to the front of the van and Niles accidentally leans on the horn._

speaker: Martin
text: Aaaarrrrghh! [_He rips the headphones off._] Niles, will you quit kidding around?  This isn't a game, it's a job!  I just want to spot the guy, get a picture and get out of here.  So why don't we just sit here and be quiet for a while.

speaker: Niles
text: You know, Dad, are you sure you want to be doing this?

speaker: Martin
text: I thought you said you weren't worried about me.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, I'm not worried about your safety, I just mean are you doing the right thing?  Meddling in this guy's marriage. You know, speaking as a psychiatrist...

speaker: Martin
text: Oh boy, open up a window.

speaker: Niles
text: I just see this sort of thing in my practice all the time. People make mistakes, and-and have affairs, and find some way to fix it.  It's possible that by taking this picture, you're destroying any chance this man has.

speaker: Martin
text: Niles, the guy's a bum!  He's probably always been a bum. Now, if you want to get into a debate about something, maybe you can tell me what those grass clippings were doing in the clam chowder.

speaker: Niles
text: That was lemon grass, and Chef Andre has gotten high kudos for that soup.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, if kudos are those brown chewy things, he can have 'em.  I put mine in the ashtray.

speaker: Niles
text: You pretend to be such a cynic.  I think you agree with me. You have too much of a conscience not to.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, bappity, bappity, bap.  Oh, there they are!  [_He grabs the camera._]

speaker: Niles
text: You're still gonna take this picture?

speaker: Martin
text: Ho-ho, you're damned right I am!

speaker: Niles
text: Even though right now that man may be planning to break it off with his girlfriend tonight?  Planning to, to rededicate himself to his marriage?  The terrible guilt spurring him on to ever-greater depths of commitment, and, and, and years from now he may be sitting with his wife, by the fire, holding her hand, reflecting on all their wonderful years together, especially their SUNSET years.  And you could destroy all that with one click of a camera.

speaker: Martin
text: Sorry, Niles, what were you saying?

speaker: Niles
text: You took a picture of that tree and you know it!

speaker: Martin
text: All right, I did!  What'd you have to talk about all that stuff for?

speaker: Niles
text: I was just saying what you were already thinking.  You did the right thing and you're not gonna to regret it.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, well how am I going to tell Donny I just sat here and watched them walk by and get in the car?

speaker: Niles
text: You'll tell him proudly because you know in your heart of hearts...

speaker: Martin
text: Whoa!  They backed into your Mercedes!

speaker: Niles
text: I don't believe it!  They're not even leaving a note... they're driving away!

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I wouldn't worry about it, Niles.  They're probably RACKED with grief and it'll spur them on to ever-greater...

speaker: Niles
text: Oh shut up and take their picture!  Hurry up and get their license number!  Hurry!  Hurry!   **LIKE TWO SHIPS SINKING IN THE NIGHT** _Scene 4 - Roz's Hotel Room Roz and Frasier are sitting on the couch, drinking champagne. Frasier has changed into his pajamas._

speaker: Roz
text: Ummm, my longest relationship would have to be Ted, '88 to '90.  No!  Derek, '89 to '92.

speaker: Frasier
text: Being a gentleman, Roz, I won't point out the slight overlap there.

speaker: Roz
text: It's not an overlap, it's a transition.

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh-huh.

speaker: Roz
text: You know, like in April when you start wearing your spring clothes, even though you're wearing your winter stuff?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah, well, if we're talking April of '90, I doubt you were wearing much of anything at all.

speaker: Roz
text: OK, wise guy, what was your longest relationship?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's easy, Lilith.  Although... [_he laughs_]

speaker: Roz
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, if we're not talking romantic relationship, well, then umm, my longest relationship with a woman would be you: seven years.

speaker: Roz
text: Loser!  [_They laugh._]  Seven years!

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh.

speaker: Roz
text: My God, it has been that long.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's worth toasting.

speaker: Roz
text: Absolutely.  [_They clink glasses and take a sip._]  So Frasier, what's with the beard?

speaker: Frasier
text: You hate it.

speaker: Roz
text: No!  Actually I like it.  It's like you're Frasier but not Frasier.  What made you do it?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I don't know.  I just wanted to change things a little, I don't know, be spontaneous.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, my God, I almost did something like that this weekend.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, I... Oh, hell, I'll show you!  [_She puts down her glass and gets up, putting her hand on Frasier's leg._] Ooh, nice silk pajamas. [_heading for the bathroom_] I made a little purchase on my way up here.

speaker: Frasier
text: Did you?  Well, I am just dying with anticipation.  What is it?

speaker: Roz
text: You promise you won't laugh?

speaker: Frasier
text: I promise.

speaker: Roz
text: OK.  Hold on one second.  I'll be right out!

speaker: Roz
text: I just wanted to see for once in my life what it would be like to be a blonde.  I thought I'd wear it down to the bar one night.  Pretty pathetic, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: On the contrary, Roz.  It's, it's quite becoming.  It's like you're Roz but not Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: [_in a sultry voice_]  Hello stranger.  You here for the conference?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I am.

speaker: Roz
text: Is this seat taken?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's been waiting for you all its life.  [_She sits next to him._]  Champagne?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I'm not sure I should.  I already had one glass, and it went straight to my head.  I feel like maybe I should lie down.

speaker: Frasier
text: You could use my room...

speaker: Roz
text: Are you sure you're a gentleman?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I do prefer blondes... [_They break up in laughter._]

speaker: Roz
text: God, how many times have I had that conversation?

speaker: Frasier
text: What would life be without the occasional surrender to impulse?

speaker: Roz
text: It's true, it does makes you feel alive.

speaker: Frasier
text: Doing things you know you shouldn't do.

speaker: Roz
text: With people you shouldn't be with.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.  [_They look at each other._]

speaker: Roz
text: Right.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_putting down his glass_] You know, suddenly, this couch seems a little small for me.

speaker: Roz
text: Well the bed seems pretty big.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a big bed.

speaker: Roz
text: It is.  _Frasier takes her champagne glass and puts it down.  They look into each other's eyes._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz...  _He leans towards her.  She leans in and tilts her head...  There is a loud knock at the door._

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake!

speaker: Frasier
text: You all right?

speaker: Frasier
text: Kenny! Kenny: I got stuck in the storm!  Now they don't have a room for me.  I hear we're in the same boat, huh Doc?  Oh, hiya Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey. Kenny: Hey, cool wig!

speaker: Roz
text: Thanks. Kenny: Hey, wait a minute, I'm not interrupting anything, am I? Pyjamas, champagne, a fire... [_He winks broadly.  They all laugh._]  So, anyhow, can I bunk here?

speaker: Roz
text: Why not?

speaker: Frasier
text: No reason. Kenny: Great, great.  I really like that blonde hair, Roz.  You better be careful though: get the doc here all hot and bothered.  Ha ha.  [_Frasier and Roz laugh nervously._] Well, just gonna get out of these wet clothes.  I had a heck of a time gettin' here.  All these road look the same. [_Frasier and Roz come together, looking into each other's eyes again._]  I ended up taking a wrong turn...  The last thing you want to do out here in these woods is take a wrong turn.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_as Roz turns away_] Quite right, Kenny.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I, I'm not sure the beard's really workin'. I probably should shave it off.

speaker: Roz
text: I wasn't gonna say anything, but yeah.  _She takes off the wig.  Kenny comes out of the bathroom wearing pajamas and a nasal bandage._  Kenny: I don't wear one of these snore strips, I'm a buzz saw going through steel pipe.  So, ah, "Rock, Paper, Scissors" for the sofa?

speaker: Roz
text: I'll take it. Kenny: OK.  Looks like it's you and me in the bed, Doc.

speaker: Frasier
text: OK.   Kenny: [_climbing into bed_]  But I warn you, I'm a roller.  What was I thinking, drinking all that coffee on the way up here?  I'm gonna be up all night, I am WIRED.  [_He rolls over, taking all the covers with him._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, Kenny, do you think you could, uh... [_Loud snores from Kenny's side._]

speaker: Roz
text: [_over the back of the couch as she settles down_]  Goodnight, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Goodnight, Roz.
